Nope. The bomb wasn't supposed to make people gay, it was supposed to cover them in pheromones that made them attractive to heterosexual males, in the hope that friendly troops could then capture them in the confusion. (If this isn't disturbing enough, remember that the pheromones would be dispersed over an area, so everything would be hit by pheromone, including any animals in the area. This bomb really was a terrible, terrible idea.) 

In reality, pheromones can't do that.

To add to this, there's still considerable debate over whether any functional human pheromones even *exist*. The whole endeavour was roughly as scientific as the 'men who stare at goats' study.
